description.zh-cn: 明宣宗朱瞻基的原配皇后，后被废为道姑，道号静慈仙师。明英宗时恢复皇后名誉，追谥为恭让诚顺康穆静慈章皇后。
description.en: The first empress consort of the Xuande Emperor of the Ming Dynasty. She was later deposed and forced to become a Daoist nun with the title 'Jingci Xianshi'. Her title of empress was posthumously restored by Emperor Yingzong.

description.zh-cn: 中国明朝第五位皇帝，胡善祥的丈夫。
description.en: The fifth emperor of the Ming Dynasty in China, husband of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗朱瞻基的第二位皇后，明英宗的生母。原为贵妃，在胡善祥被废后成为皇后。
description.en: The second empress consort of the Xuande Emperor and the birth mother of Emperor Yingzong. Originally a noble consort, she became empress after Hu Shanxiang was deposed.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗朱瞻基与皇后胡善祥所生的长女。
description.en: The eldest daughter of the Xuande Emperor, born to Empress Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗朱瞻基与皇后胡善祥所生的女儿，未婚早逝。
description.en: A daughter of the Xuande Emperor, born to Empress Hu Shanxiang, who died young and unmarried.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥之父，官至锦衣卫指挥。
description.en: Father of Hu Shanxiang, who served as a commander of the Jinyiwei (Embroidered Uniform Guard).

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥的长姐，明太祖时期的尚宫。
description.en: The elder sister of Hu Shanxiang, who served as a Shanggong (lady-in-waiting of high rank) during the reign of the Hongwu Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗长子，明朝第六及第八位皇帝。他在孙太后去世后，恢复了胡善祥的皇后名号。
description.en: The eldest son of the Xuande Emperor, who reigned as the sixth and eighth emperor of the Ming Dynasty. After the death of Empress Dowager Sun, he posthumously restored Hu Shanxiang's title of Empress.

description.zh-cn: 明仁宗皇后、明宣宗之母。她怜悯并保护被废的胡善祥。
description.en: Empress of the Hongxi Emperor and mother of the Xuande Emperor. She pitied and protected the deposed Empress Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 明朝大学士，曾建议明英宗恢复胡善祥的皇后名号。
description.en: A Grand Secretary of the Ming Dynasty who advised Emperor Yingzong to restore Hu Shanxiang's title of Empress.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗以“无子多病”为由废黜原配皇后胡善祥，改立孙贵妃为皇后的历史事件。
description.en: The historical event in which the Xuande Emperor deposed his first empress, Hu Shanxiang, on the grounds of being 'childless and sickly', and installed Consort Sun as the new empress.

description.zh-cn: 中国山东省下辖的地级市，胡善祥的出生地。
description.en: A prefecture-level city in Shandong Province, China, the birthplace of Hu Shanxiang.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京的明朝皇家妃嫔墓葬区，胡善祥被安葬于此。
description.en: A Ming Dynasty imperial burial area for concubines in Beijing where Hu Shanxiang was interred.

description.zh-cn: 中国帝制时期的封号，指皇太孙的正妻。
description.en: A title during China's imperial era, referring to the primary consort of the Crown Grandson.

description.zh-cn: 中国帝制时期的封号，指皇太子的正妻。
description.en: A title during China's imperial era, referring to the primary consort of the Crown Prince.

description.zh-cn: 中国帝制时期的封号，指皇帝的正妻。
description.en: A title during China's imperial era, referring to the primary consort of the Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥于1417年被选为时为皇太孙的朱瞻基之妃，1425年被立为皇后，1428年被废。
description.en: Hu Shanxiang was selected as the consort for Zhu Zhanji (then the Imperial Grandson) in 1417, made empress in 1425, and deposed in 1428.

description.zh-cn: 原为贵妃，在胡善祥被废后，于1428年被立为皇后。
description.en: Originally a noble consort, she was installed as empress in 1428 after Hu Shanxiang was deposed.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥是胡善围的妹妹。
description.en: Hu Shanxiang was the younger sister of Hu Shanwei.

description.zh-cn: 胡善祥被废后，孙氏被立为新后。张太后在宫廷宴会上将胡氏的座位安排在孙皇后之上，孙皇后对此怏怏不乐，显示了两人之间的紧张关系。
description.en: After Hu Shanxiang was deposed, Lady Sun was made the new empress. Empress Dowager Zhang placed Hu's seat above Empress Sun's at court banquets, which displeased Empress Sun, indicating the tense relationship between them.

description.zh-cn: 在胡善祥被废后，身为婆母的张太后怜悯她，常召她到清宁宫居住，并在内廷朝宴时将其座席安排在孙皇后之上，给予保护和尊重。
description.en: After Hu Shanxiang was deposed, Empress Dowager Zhang, her mother-in-law, pitied her, often inviting her to live in Qingning Palace and arranging her seat above Empress Sun's at court banquets, offering protection and respect.

description.zh-cn: 宣宗废后事件导致胡善祥被废黜皇后之位，退居长安宫修道。
description.en: The event of the empress's deposition led to Hu Shanxiang being stripped of her title and retiring to Chang'an Palace to practice Daoism.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗以胡皇后“无子多病”为由，废黜其后位。
description.en: The Xuande Emperor deposed Empress Hu on the grounds that she was 'childless and sickly'.

description.zh-cn: 孙贵妃生下皇长子明英宗，为宣宗废后提供了借口。
description.en: The birth of the eldest imperial son, the future Emperor Yingzong, by Consort Sun provided a pretext for the Xuande Emperor to depose the empress.

description.zh-cn: 天顺七年，明英宗采纳大臣建议，为胡善祥恢复皇后名号，上尊谥“恭让诚顺康穆静慈章皇后”，并为其修陵寝。
description.en: In the 7th year of the Tianshun era (1463), Emperor Yingzong accepted his minister's advice and posthumously restored Hu Shanxiang's title of empress, bestowing upon her the full posthumous name and building a mausoleum for her.

description.zh-cn: 明英宗就是否应为胡善祥复位一事询问李贤，李贤给予了肯定的答复，推动了此事的最终决定。
description.en: When Emperor Yingzong inquired about whether to restore Hu Shanxiang's title, Li Xian gave an affirmative answer, pushing forward the final decision.
